snippet: The Bundesbank said the German economy would grow 0.3 percent in 2013, down from an early projection of 0.4 percent, because of slack demand from other European nations.
abstract: Germany's central bank, Bundesbank, says country's economy will grow 0.3 percent in 2013, down from early projection of 0.4 percent, due to slack demand from other European nations.
lead_paragraph: The Bundesbank said the German economy would grow 0.3 percent in 2013, down from an early projection of 0.4 percent, because of slack demand from other European nations.

headline.seo: German Central Bank Cuts Growth Prediction for 2013
headline.main: German Central Bank Cuts Growth Prediction for 2013
headline.print_headline: Central Bank Trims Forecast for Growth in Germany
